revised_title: Anatomy and Growth of Teeth in Elephants and Other Graminivorous Quadrupeds
tldr: The author examines the structure and growth of teeth in elephants and other graminivorous quadrupeds. They discovered that elephant teeth have a unique structure composed of different materials and processes, which is also found in the teeth of other animals that need to grind their food. The author also refutes a previous theory on enamel formation and provides evidence for their own findings.
